message_1: What is the balanced chemical equation for the single replacement reaction between zinc and hydrochloric acid to produce hydrogen gas and zinc chloride?
message_2:
The balanced chemical equation for the single replacement reaction between zinc (Zn) and hydrochloric acid (HCl) to produce hydrogen gas (H2) and zinc chloride (ZnCl2) is:

Zn (s) + 2 HCl (aq) â†’ H2 (g) + ZnCl2 (aq)
